section.title: openedx.core.djangoapps.content_staging.api module
section.paragraph: Public python API for content staging

desc_content.paragraph: Get the OLX (as a string) for the given StagedContent.
Does not check permissions!
Get the data for the static asset associated with the given staged content.
Does not check permissions!
Get the filenames and metadata for any static files used by the given staged content.
Does not check permissions!
Get the details of the user’s clipboard.
By default, will only return a value if the clipboard is READY to use for pasting etc. Pass only_ready=False to get the clipboard data regardless.
To get the actual OLX content, use get_staged_content_olx(content.id)
Get the detailed status of the user’s clipboard, in exactly the same format as returned from the

REST API endpoint. This version of the API is meant for “preloading” that REST API endpoint so it can be embedded in a larger response sent to the user’s browser. If you just want to get the clipboard data from python, use get_user_clipboard() instead, since it’s fully typed.
(request is optional; including it will make the “olx_url” absolute instead of relative.)
Copy an XBlock’s OLX to the user’s clipboard.

“Stage” an XBlock by copying it (and its associated children + static assets) into the content staging area. This XBlock can then be accessed and manipulated using any of the staged content APIs, before being deleted.
Bases: AppConfig
Configuration for the content_staging Django plugin application. See: https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/master/openedx/core/djangoapps/plugins/README.rst

section.title: openedx.core.djangoapps.content_staging.data module
section.paragraph: Public python data types for content staging

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: object
Read-only data model representing StagedContent
(OLX content that isn’t part of any course at the moment)
Bases: object
Read-only data model for a single file used by some staged content.
Bases: TextChoices
The status of this staged content.
Bases: object
Read-only data model for User Clipboard data (copied OLX)
Get the context (course/library) that this was copied from
Bases: Model

Each StagedContent instance represents a “piece” of content (e.g. a single XBlock, or a single Unit, or a single Subsection of a course) that is not currently part of any course or library, but which is available to be copied into a course or library.
Use as a clipboard: for any given user, the most recent row with purpose=CLIPBOARD is the “current” clipboard content. But it can only be pasted if its status is READY.
Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist
Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.
Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

Bases: Model
A data file (“Static Asset”) associated with some StagedContent.
These usually come from a course’s Files & Uploads page, but can also come from per-xblock file storage (e.g. video transcripts or images used in v2 content libraries).
Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist
Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned
The descriptor for the file attribute on the model instance. Return a FieldFile when accessed so you can write code like:
desc_content.literal_block: >>> from myapp.models import MyModel >>> instance = MyModel.objects.get(pk=1) >>> instance.file.size
desc_content.paragraph: Assign a file object on assignment so you can do:
desc_content.literal_block: >>> with open('/path/to/hello.world') as f: ... instance.file = File(f)

Each user has a clipboard that can hold one item at a time, where an item is some OLX content that can be used in a course, such as an XBlock, a Unit, or a Subsection.

section.title: openedx.core.djangoapps.content_staging.serializers module
section.paragraph: Serializers for the content libraries REST API

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: Serializer
Serializer for the POST request body when putting a new XBlock into the user’s clipboard.
Bases: ModelSerializer
Serializer for staged content. Doesn’t include the OLX by default.
Bases: object
alias of StagedContent
Get the friendly name for this XBlock/component type
Bases: Serializer
Serializer for the status of the user’s clipboard (a UserClipboardData instance)
Get the URL where the user can edit the given XBlock, if it exists

section.title: openedx.core.djangoapps.content_staging.urls module
section.paragraph: Studio URL configuration for Content Staging (& Clipboard)

section.title: openedx.core.djangoapps.content_staging.views module
section.paragraph: REST API views for content staging

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: APIView
API Endpoint that can be used to get the status of the current user’s clipboard or to POST some content to the clipboard.
.dispatch() is pretty much the same as Django’s regular dispatch, but with extra hooks for startup, finalize, and exception handling.
Get the detailed status of the user’s clipboard. This does not return the OLX.
Put some piece of content into the user’s clipboard.

FIXME: This API needs to be deprecated and replaced by dedicated APIs within each learning context (POST /course/foo/bar/copy, POST /library/foo/bar/copy, etc.) We don’t want to encode course- and library-specific logic in content staging, and it shouldn’t import course or library modules.
Bases: APIView
API Endpoint to get the OLX of any given StagedContent.
Get the OLX of the given StagedContent object.
